committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the United States, Mexico, and Canada should establish a common economic bond of energy cooperation.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate and the House of Representatives that the United States, Mexico, and Canada should establish a common economic bond of energy cooperation and that the President should invite the leaders of those countries to a summit meeting to discuss the energy needs of the countries, joint development of energy sources, and the establishment of a North American partnership between the countries.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that the United States, Mexico, and Canada should establish a common economic bond of energy cooperation.
